com.zensols.gui.pref

Class PrefSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zensols.gui.pref.PrefSupport

  • public class PrefSupport
extends Object

    This class interfaces with the Java preferences system and registers callback for the other framework components in this package.

    In order, you want to:
    • Construct this object and pass it around to your GUI components.
    • Each component call addListener(PrefsListener)
    • Call unpersist() to populate from the Java preferences system.
    • Call setEnabled(boolean) with true.
    Author:
    Paul Landes

      • addListener

        public void addListener(PrefsListener listener)
        Register a call back listener called for preference (load) updates.
        Parameters:
        listener - gets invoked with preference persists and unpersists

      • hasPreferences

        public boolean hasPreferences()
        Returns:
        if we have preferences, which can be important for initial preference load/setting.

      • unpersisted

        public boolean unpersisted()
        Returns:
        if we've unpersisted yet or not, which can be important for initial preference load/settings.

      • getPreferences

        public Preferences getPreferences()
        Returns:
        the Java system preferences.

      • unpersist

        public void unpersist()
        Unpersist, which invokes all the callback (observer/listeners). Note this does nothing if this instance is not enabled.
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • persist

        public void persist()
        Persist the current state of this object to the Java preferences system. Note this does nothing if the instance isn't enabled.
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • getEanbled
